department.dept_long_name: Division of Engineering and Applied Sciences

course.title: Innovating in Health Care
course.meeting_text: See HBS course schedule for course meeting day/times and location
course.faculty_text: Regina E. Herzlinger (Business School) and Margo I. Seltzer
course.description: This course helps students to create successful entrepreneurial health care ventures by enabling them to: 1) Identify the alignment between an entrepreneurial health care venture and the six forces that shape health care - structure, financing, technology, consumers, accountability, and public policy; and 2) Create a product and business model that responds appropriately to any misalignments. The course covers four modules: The analytic framework, case studies of the six forces, case studies of firms responses to the forces, and student presentation of business plans.
course.notes: Must be taken concurrently with ES233b. Offered jointly with the Business School as 6340.
